title: @Riot, when the time comes for Kayn skins, would there be a chance to see him getting a dual theme?
body:
What I mean is, with the different forms Kayn has, he has the potential for skins that actually have two themes in one. Something like taking a Infernal skin and a Freljord skin and combine them into one skin for him. Shadow Assassin would become the freljord aspect, creating ice effects on his abilities, and Raahst would take on the Infernal aspect, giving him fiery effects while his base form would be a sort of hybrid of the two. I think there could be a lot of potential for him skin wise in this sense, trying out many different dual themed skin combos, for example:

>Bio-Forge <-> Steel Legion 
Arcade <-> Boss Battle
Radiant <-> Lunar Wraith
Program <-> Battle Cast
Warden <-> Marauder
Swen  Chaos <-> Toy

To me, I think it would really set him apart on the skin front and give him his own niche to work with when coming up with skin designs for him.

its project Kayn and Program Rhaast
Program is further in the future than PROJECT. It'd be PROJECT <-> Battlecast.
battle cast from looking at their splash take place in an apocalyptic sorta future since they are shown in a waste land looking background

True to an extent. This is the timeline.

Battlecast vs Mecha happens where Battlecast wins. Giving Viktor full control over Ionia and creating Neo-Ionia from the PROJECT: Overdrive cinematic.

Then later, the PROJECT skins come into existence. Launching a rebellion against Viktor and his creations. After that, the Programs come about, as showcased by their full android-ness, compared to the PROJECT fusion of humans and tech. Then, after THAT, is where we reach Pulsefire-- officially the furthest point in that skin's universe's lore. Although it isn't specified if Pulsefire originates from the Evolution Timeline (BC, Mecha, PROJECT), we can infer from the tech shown by Cait and Ez that it is the farthest point in any timeline, with only Program coming close to it, but still fairly far away. Besides, the Program and PROJECT skins have nothing to do with each other. Dreadnova seems like it'd be the furthest, but I think it's just an alternate universe point where we are in the current League continuity.
Doubt riot will make many kayn skins tbh. Twice the work for the same amount of money.
